intro: Delissea membranacea, commonly known as the membranous delissea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a delicate, membranous texture, which gives it its common name. Delissea membranacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and modest floral display.
